executive_summary: Online Stock Brokerages are expected to grow through the end of 2023. Revenue is expected to inch upward at a CAGR of 0.3% to an estimated $10.7 billion through the end of 2023, including an estimated 5.1% growth in 2023. Online brokers gained customers at an accelerating pace during the same period as more investors left their brokers and started trading online. Despite the recession, brokers endured revenue growth as more investors made trades amid market volatility. In 2020, due to the spread of COVID-19, people stayed indoors to avoid contracting the virus...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online stock brokerages are expected to endure revenue inching upward
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online stock brokerages are expected to endure revenue inching upward at a CAGR of 0.3% to an estimated $10.7 billion through the end of 2023, including 5.1% growth in 2023, when profit is poised to reach 11.6%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Surge in Volatility Amid COVID-19 Heightens Interest in Online Stock Brokerages
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online stock brokerages have benefited from a surge in online account opening over the past five years, as a diverse array of investors looked to take advantage of economic volatility.
While online brokerage services were growing, players sought to expand their offerings to gain new customers and sway existing traders from other firms.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Recovery of Global Economic Conditions Poised to Accelerate Investor Appetite
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As economic conditions stabilize following COVID-19 and global markets recover, investor confidence is set to rise in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Adoption of Technology Set to Diversify Brokers' Customer Base
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The implementation of new technology into the infrastructure of online stock brokerages will help incentivize a variety of customers to sign up to an online stock brokerage account.

industry_definition: Online stock brokerages operate online websites that act as agents in the buying and selling of stocks or other securities.
key_trends: A sudden shift toward online trading amid COVID-19 bolstered core revenue channels
Continued innovation in technology and software bolstered online brokers' appeal

market_segmentation.segment: Retail investors over the age of 54
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment generates revenue among retail investors over the age of 54.
This market segment generates revenue from institutional investors.
During COVID-19, this age group significantly spiked in terms of usage.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from commissions and transaction fees generated from the sales of equity securities.
This product segment generates revenue via transaction fees and commissions from the sale of debt securities.

tier_1_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Semiconductor & Circuit Manufacturing in the US
Circuit Board & Electronic Component Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Online and discount brokerage services are predominantly used by retail investors.
The price and volatility of securities can influence trading levels.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports and imports are not applicable to the Online Stock Brokerages industry.

business_locations.location_description: Although online stock brokerages traditionally operate with one main establishment.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Market participants are required to register as broker-dealers.

barriers_points.barrier_description: There are significant legal barriers faced by new entrants.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition within the Online Stock Brokerages industry is expected to be high and increasing.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Online brokerages have continued to advance their product offering.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: High Cost of Maintenance Exacerbates Administrative Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The largest expenditure for online stock brokerages continues to be administrative costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Online Stock Brokerages industry is dependent on technology and IT systems.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Online Stock Brokerages Endure Moderate Revenue Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for online stock brokerages is highly dependent on the state of the economy.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online Stock Brokerages depend on technological innovation to remain competitive.

FAQs.question: What media channels are you using to attract consumers and investors, if any?
